title: GIS Manager - USA-PA-Middletown

Profile 
The PTC is seeking a highly motivated individual to fill a “GIS Manager” position within its Information Technology Department. This position manages and supports the collection, storage, analysis, manipulation and presentation of complex geographical information through a computerized system. This position is located at the PTC’s headquarters in Middletown, PA. 
Duties and Responsibilities: Develops service-level agreement (SLA) standards for GIS solutions. Reviews contracted staff’s performance. Ensures proper monitoring and reporting of any deviations from the SLA. Designs and develops various types of GIS integrated business solutions and geospatial solutions including geo-database design, business workflow programming, web applications and mapping. Creates and maintains layer files, labeling expressions and definition queries. Reviews and approves GIS change requests from a technical standpoint. Manages the change request activities including assigning of tasks, scheduling implementation and supervising activities. Ensures the accuracy and reliability of GIS products and services in accordance with established standards. Develops, monitors and coordinates project activities such as scheduling, tracking and reporting to assess the impact of planned changes. Manages internal and/or external staff involved in multiple complex enterprise-wide objectives. Responsible for the supervision, performance management, delegation of work assignments and review of work product. 
Requirements and Qualifications: Bachelor degree in Information Technology * ; and Seven years of experience in a Geographic Information Systems (GIS) or Information Technology field, which includes four years of experience managing GIS solutions*; and Possession of a valid Pennsylvania driver’s license 
* Equivalent combination of experience, education, and training will be considered 
The annual salary range for this position is $77,234-$114,629. 
If an accommodation is needed to participate in the pre-employment process, please include this information with your resume. The PTC is an equal opportunity employer that offers competitive salaries, attractive benefits package and retirement program. There is a Pennsylvania residency requirement, which must be fulfilled within six months of employment. 
Interested candidates may click "Apply Now" to be directed to our site to apply. Please complete an application and specifically apply to this position from October 2-October 16, 2015. Company info Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission 
Company Profile The Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission (PTC) is a premiere transportation organization whose mission is to responsibly operate and manage a safe, reliable and efficient toll road system, serve as a transportation services leader and foster innovation to better serve our customers. Opened since October 1, 1940, the PTC operates a 552-mile system used by 194 million vehicles a year. Employer job
